definition: motionless
(negative prefix)/not/no
(of sth) to move/to set in movement/to displace/to touch/to make use of/to stir (emotions)/to alter/abbr. for 動詞|动词[dong4 ci2], verb
real estate/immovable property/immovables
(typically followed by 就[jiu4]) apt to (lose one's temper, catch a cold etc)/at the drop of a hat
motionless
not a word or movement (idiom); remaining calm and collected/not batting an eyelid
to hold back one's troops without moving (idiom); to bide one's time
not shaken by thunder (idiom); the arrangements are unalterable/to adhere rigidly to regulations/will go ahead whatever happens (of an arrangement or plan)
sticking unmoving to the original (idiom); not an iota changed/untouched
to not move a single jot (idiom)
to be unable to carry/lift (sth heavy)
a gentleman uses his mouth and not his fist
pinyin: jun1 zi3 dong4 kou3 bu4 dong4 shou3

definition: fixed point (of a map) (math.)
absolutely still/fig. not the slightest change/also written 文風不動|文风不动
absolutely still/fig. not the slightest change/also written 紋風不動|纹风不动
unmoved
fixed point theorem (math.)

sentences.english: The poor old man plods along, hardly able to lift each food.
sentences.chinese: 这可怜白勺白叟吃力地走着，几乎都抬不动脚了。

sentences.english: My father is too old to do any work now.
sentences.chinese: 我父亲现在太老，干不动什么活了。

sentences.english: The key won't move, it need oiling .
sentences.chinese: 钥匙转不动了，它需要上油了。

sentences.english: All the things in the room were kept changeless.
sentences.chinese: 房间里的所有东西都保持原封不动。

sentences.english: He had become very still. Saliva was at the corners of his mouth.
sentences.chinese: 爸爸已经一动不动了，嘴角上还淌着口水。

sentences.english: The child is too young to hold a kettle. The water spilled all over the floor.
sentences.chinese: 孩子太小提不动壶，水泼出来淌了一地。

sentences.english: I can't move any farther; I'm done up.
sentences.chinese: 我再也挪不动了，我精疲力竭了。

sentences.english: The desk is so heavy. I can't move it.
sentences.chinese: 这个桌子太重了，我挪不动它。

sentences.english: It can’t eat anymore, it is even difficult to move, and fish still swims in the lake.
sentences.chinese: 再也吃不下一条鱼，甚至连走都走不动了。

sentences.english: The fish was silvery and still and floated with the waves.
sentences.chinese: 那鱼是银色的，一动不动地随着波浪浮动着。

sentences.english: No one can move the sofa single-handed.
His car got bogged down and wouldn't move.
sentences.chinese: 他的车子陷入泥沼开不动了。

sentences.english: If you can't turn the key, try putting some oil in the lock.
sentences.chinese: 如果你转不动钥匙，试着往锁里倒点油。

sentences.english: These huge boxes should be, and can only be moved by rollers.
sentences.chinese: 这些大箱子必须用滚杠，否则根本挪不动。

sentences.english: Most strong-bodied man as he is, he can't move the big stone.
sentences.chinese: 他虽然是最强壮的，但他也搬不动那块大石头。

sentences.english: Avoid sedentary like sitting down is harmful to health.
sentences.chinese: 忌久坐喜欢坐着不动，对身体健康是有害的。

definition: (of sth) to move/to set in movement/to displace/to touch/to make use of/to stir (emotions)/to alter/abbr. for 動詞|动词[dong4 ci2], verb
(in) the original place/the place where one currently is/place of origin/local (product)
to not move a single jot (idiom)
to fiddle with/to tamper with/to meddle with/to move randomly/to flail about
won't do/be out of the question/be no good/not work/not be capable
to budge
to be not less than (a certain quantity, amount etc)
repeatedly/continuously/constantly/unable to (resist, conceal etc)
no need/need not
there
hand/(formal) to hold/person engaged in certain types of work/person skilled in certain types of work/personal(ly)/convenient/classifier for skill/CL:雙|双[shuang1],隻|只[zhi1]
to stop
original spot/previous place/where it was before
there is nothing to be done/one can't do anything about it
to go down/to descend/to go on/to continue/(of a servant) to withdraw
a moment/a while/in a moment/also pr. [yi1 hui3]
